result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey C Kosco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Corey C Kosco is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Corey C Kosco was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **04-29-16 defendant may serve the sentence of this case at the Waukesha County Huber Facility with work release privileges.
PROBATION REVIEW hearing February 12, 2016 at 1:15 p.m. Br. 38.

miscConds.notes:
Provide   DNA sample, pay costs.  Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and supervison fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Any cash bail on deposit to be applied.
*Restitution set at zero.

No contact with the victim unless requested by victim, and then only with prior approval of agent or the Court.
No contact with firearms.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete anger management and continued programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  5-13-2016 Review hearing is cancelled.

Signed and filed on 4-29-16:  Decision and Order Granting Request for Huber Privileges.

The defendant may serve the sentence of this case at the Waukesha County Huber Facility with work release privileges.

*copy to defendant and district attorney*
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michelle Ackerman Havas, Br. 45, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges and for transfer to Waukesha Huber facility.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Amended JOC reflects 02-12-16 Court order imposing   5   days of condition time

Defendant Corey C Kosco in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 5 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $540.00 entered as ordered by the court on 02/02/16 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 12/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Order for payment of attorney fees and costs signed and filed. ccp

Defendant Corey C Kosco in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Corey C Kosco in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.

As to Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Corey C Kosco in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court they are ready to proceed to trial on today's date.
Court has a number of trials scheduled (unrelated to this case) today and orders case passed.

Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance at today's scheduled pre-trial conference.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

Defendant Corey C Kosco in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant indigent.   Court appoints Attorney John Krejci who was present and agreed to accept the case.  Court orders Attorney Krejci  to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Defendant will repay the County at the rate of $60.00 per month commencing upon the conclusion of case, or if not paid, a CIVIL JUDGMENT.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-2-2015 at 8:30 am.   All conditions of bail are continued, including the no contact order with Heather W. or Jessica R., no guns in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Heather W;  Jessica R.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Corey C Kosco in court with attorney Kathleen Judith Osvat.  Defendant Corey C Kosco in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.
